alert.note: Alert for West Glacier Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued November 01 at 2:15PM MDT until November 02 at 1:00PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO 1 PM MDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches. Accumulations of 5 to 8 inches above 4000 feet. Isolated areas of freezing rain are expected before the precipitation changes to all snow. A light glaze of ice is possible. * WHERE...Bad Rock Canyon, Essex, Highway 83 Bigfork to Swan Lake, Marias Pass, and Polebridge. * WHEN...From 3 AM to 1 PM MDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions and reduced visibility during periods of heavy snow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
